title: Teen accidentally shot by friend in east Las Vegas
content:
LAS VEGAS (FOX5) -
Police said they are looking for the person who accidentally shot his friend in east Las Vegas early Friday morning.
The shooting happened about 3 a.m. at an apartment near Lamb Boulevard and Vegas Valley Drive.
According to Las Vegas Metro police, a 17-year-old boy was being shown a handgun by his 18-year-old friend, when the gun fired. The boy was wounded in the leg.
The victim was taken to Sunrise Trauma to be treated, police said. He is expected to recover.
Investigators said they are looking for the boy's friend, who ran from the scene after the shooting.
